definition: hard to distinguish real from imitation

sentences.english: In fact I'd guess even the first lady might have trouble telling them apart.
sentences.chinese: 說真的，我猜連第一夫人都可能會真假難辨。

sentences.english: But this distinction will become more difficult as the technology advances.
sentences.chinese: 但是，隨着技術的進步將越來越真假難辨。

sentences.english: The artificial rockery showing no artificial trace, is difficult to distinguish between true and false.
sentences.chinese: 而人爲的假山不露人工的痕跡，令人真假難辨。

definition: to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
pavilion in the air (idiom); unrealistic Utopian construction/castles in Spain/imaginary future plans
